Package pro.husk.fakeblock.objects

Class WallUtility

java.lang.Object
pro.husk.fakeblock.objects.WallUtility
public final class WallUtility
extends Object
Utility class for Walls, utilised for on the fly handling of FakeBlock visibility functionality

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    WallUtility​(boolean inverse)
    Constructor of WallUtility

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    CompletableFuture<List<WallObject>> getNearbyFakeBlocks​(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
    Method for checking if a location is close to wall Method time complexity is O(n) with n being number of walls Uses an ExpiringMap to reduce calls of users who are quite some distance away
    boolean locationIsInsideWall​(org.bukkit.Location targetLocation)
    Helper method to check if a location is between any wall Used for block place and block break checks Time complexity of O(n) with n being the number of walls This is used instead of just checking if the WallObject blocksInBetween contains(location) because There is a near always guarantee that number of blocksInBetween is greater than amount of wall objects Therefore is faster to call this method
    void processWall​(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, int delay, boolean ignorePermission)
    Process check of player location near the wall async, and if they are close, send fake blocks
    void processWallConditions​(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
    Process check of player location near the wall async, and if they are close, send either the real or fake blocks Used for LuckPerms hook

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • WallUtility

      public WallUtility​(boolean inverse)
      Constructor of WallUtility
      Parameters:
      inverse - whether or not to inverse permission checks

  • Method Details

    • getNearbyFakeBlocks

      public CompletableFuture<List<WallObject>> getNearbyFakeBlocks​(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Method for checking if a location is close to wall Method time complexity is O(n) with n being number of walls Uses an ExpiringMap to reduce calls of users who are quite some distance away
      Parameters:
      player - to check
      Returns:
      null if not, wallObject if they are

    • processWall

      public void processWall​(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, int delay, boolean ignorePermission)
      Process check of player location near the wall async, and if they are close, send fake blocks
      Parameters:
      player - to check
      delay - on sending blocks
      ignorePermission - whether or not to ignore whether or not the player has permission

    • processWallConditions

      public void processWallConditions​(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Process check of player location near the wall async, and if they are close, send either the real or fake blocks Used for LuckPerms hook
      Parameters:
      player - to check

    • locationIsInsideWall

      public boolean locationIsInsideWall​(org.bukkit.Location targetLocation)
      Helper method to check if a location is between any wall Used for block place and block break checks Time complexity of O(n) with n being the number of walls This is used instead of just checking if the WallObject blocksInBetween contains(location) because There is a near always guarantee that number of blocksInBetween is greater than amount of wall objects Therefore is faster to call this method
      Parameters:
      targetLocation - location to check
      Returns:
      true if the location is in a wall, false if not
